text:
I heard there s a new boba spot opening n I definitely want to try sth new. N they promote that they make organic boba tea n I really want to try. It located at the corner of a sort of ghetto  plaza, which makes me feel unsafe around. When I walked in the store, staff greeted me warmly but I m surprised that how hard the store tried to copy Brew Tea Bar. (Will they also copy King Fu Tea n Tea Space? Let me know, lol.) 
I had the highly recommended tea, strawberry matcha latte and It s definitely NOTHING organic or powder-free. How come a strawberry that red? It has to be cooked with whatever illegal amount of color ingredient. How come Matcha stuff made without powder?  It s water down n too sweet to cover the tea flavor or maybe no real tea actually used. Their other topping looks weird as they presented to me to prove their stuff to be organic.
Every boba tea is made with certain amount of syrup. That is the truth. If they try to promote their "organic" stuff, then they got to use serious organic stuff like whole food n be honest to their customers. Customers r smart! I rather trust they making tea with certain amount of syrup n try their best to use fresh fruit at the moment of purchase n production. 
ALSO, the container is NOT recommended for refill due to the #1 level plastic container regulation. It is NOT safe to refill with that kind of bottle. Finally, Hope they understand the definition of organic n don't try to fool the market. I d rather stick with Mr.Tea , at least they use real fruit at production n cook real tea daily.
The only tea place in Vegas that gives you a trendy LAish feeling. I stopped by everyday whenever I'm in town. Love their Oolong Milk tea! This is an Oasis!
This place is awesome!  Wonderful tea and good music.  Wish I could take this place back east to continue getting their tasty teas!

Their guava green tea is bomb diggity. This place is tight af. Not only is there zebra decorations but they got ZOMBIE ones too! Mr. Z really lives up to his name!  The chick here right af too! She recommended some bomb ass shit, like the drink I got was cold but it was fire! A must go

Best tea place in town! Love the store deco!

Orange green tea is the BOMB! Seasonal fruit smoothies are refreshing and healthy choice too!

Their Orange Green Tea is really refreshing!!! It really hit the spot after a big dim sum lunch. I have never tasted anything quite as refreshing as this drink. I highly recommend this. 

Yolo, the owner, is very welcoming and friendly. 

I will definitely be coming back. 

I wish that they have a location nearby where I live, so I don't have to drive all the way over here.
the best boba shop in Vegas. Good vibeluv their store design  and their red bean milk tea r sooooooo good

I have to admit, this is probably one of my favorite boba shops in Vegas. Boba drinks are becoming extremely popular and that means a lot of places are serving low quality boba drinks. Mr. Z is the exception because they have really master the art of boba drinks.

AMAZON: The Amazon Drink is their specialty! If you go here and don't try it at least once, I'm judging you! The Amazon is passion fruit and kiwi blended with boba. I was a little hesitant myself when I heard the boba is blended, but adventurous me tried it and loved it. I can honestly not explain how satisfying it tastes to have your boba blended in the drink. Definitely my favorite drink here.

OTHER DRINKS: They also offer the basic boba drinks like teas, slushes, and milk teas. But what makes me love this place is their drinks are really fresh and unique. They have flavors that you can't find anywhere else like the Kumquat drink. They have really flavorful drinks like the kiwi slush. For milk teas, I highly recommend the honeydew milk tea. Their drinks are all super refreshing.

SETTING: The staff is super friendly and helpful. I couldn't decide which drink I want and they kindly explained their drinks to me. There is a zebra painted on the wall and their are zebra statues everywhere. So cute! They even had a zebra balloon when I was there. Their are high top seating, but it's pretty limited. The do have a small grass area in the restaurant which make a unique comfy area.
Great service and nice atmosphere! Awesome and delicious variety of drinks, available hot and cold.

[AMBIANCE+CONVENIENCE+PARKING]
*** 4/5 ***
  Walking into the shop, I felt that it had a nice vibe to it. It was clean, cute, and very picturesque. Their theme involved a lot of zebras... hence the name of the shop, "Mr. Z Tea Co"...and I was definitely feelin' it since zebras are one of my fave animals hehe.  They have a nice mural of a zebra above the two couches on the left of the shop. 
  This place isn't really made for studying as there are only two small tables and some bar stools plus no WiFi (points taken off for that lol). I'd say it's more of a pick up and go type of place.
  This shop is located in a small plaza with other busy businesses, so parking isn't always easy to find, but they do have a couple of designated parking spots just for them in front of their shop for people who are on the go. 

[SERVICE]
*** 3/5 ***
  Came here on a slow day. There were only about 2 customers (both busy studying) and 2 male employees on-site scrambling in the back. My sister and I walk in and we take a look at the menu. It was our first time so we had a few questions. We stood there for more than 10 minutes waiting for someone to pay us any attention. We saw one of them glance at us but continued to work on something in the back. My sister literally said, "If they don't come out and help us in one minute, we're leaving". I don't know if a little birdie whispered in their ear or what, but after she said that, someone finally came to help us. 
  After taking our order, they got busy right away with making our drinks. Took about 6 minutes to make them, no biggie. They didn't really smile at all or have the best customer service, but they got the job done. 

[DRINKS]
*** 5/5 ***
  I ordered the Orange Butterfly Pea in the cute tall zebra bottle. It has a purple layer on top and then an orange layer on the bottom. I'm not entirely sure how it works but  I believe it has something to do with the specific gravity or (relative density) of each liquid. The more sugary and heavier the substance is, the greater weight and specific gravity it has -- also the more likely it will sink to the bottom(orange). But heck, what do I know. it's been a while since I've studied physiology/physics! Whatever the process is, just know that it was really good! Lol! Super refreshing + not overly sweet = My kind of drink ;)
  Anyway, my sister ordered the Winter-melon milk tea, half sweetened with boba and it was BOMB. The boba had a nice consistency (soft and chewy). The Winter-melon kind of reminded me of an almond milk tea but less sweeter. It was gooooood!
  I can tell their drinks are crafted with a lot of thought put into them. Lots of creative fruity tea drinks, milk teas, coffee, and slushies. We both really enjoyed our drinks! 



I think it's safe to say that we will be back soon!! :)
This is the cutest little boba shop! The decor is absolutely adorable and the all the ingredients are fresh

My must go-to place when I visiting Vegas! They have fresh tea all the time and the interior is very cute, too! My favorite tea is oolong milk tea with boba, sometime I will add green tea jelly which is jelly made out of jasmine tea! Ahhh I'm craving for it now..time to go Vegas again!
I'm a big fan of their watermelon green tea. It's like a combination of slush and tea. The service is always quick and prompt.

This is my new favorite place for drinks! Everything tastes fresh and bright and they have unique flavors that other boba cafes do not have. I had the Amazon slush which was passionfruit with kiwi syrup and blended bits of boba and it was absolutely delicious. 10/10 would go again

So I came to try out the yogurt pea and the guy said it takes 30 mins to make, he seemed annoyed when I said I would wait so I said nvm. I personally think if they advertise these cool drinks they should have them available. We were sitting on the other end of counter and realized our drinks had been sitting but he never told us they were ready our order was wrong and the slushes were only half full because they were in a mountain pile. All in all I expected a lot more. Luckily the drinks tasted ok.

I love the drinks I got here so far, the guava green tea and the milk tea. The milk tea has just enought sweetness to it compares to the guava. I would definitely come back for the drink when im in town. The staff were friendly and really knows what he is doing.

Oh my god this place has the best pudding milk teas!!!

And the service is phenomenal. I lost my wallet there and they found it plus all the cash was still there.
This place was super empty when we went and it still took 15 minutes to get our drinks. Drinks were meh. Not going back.

There's a surge of new boba spots opening up lately! Mr. Z is a solid option with a cute zebra theme and a menu of interesting flavors, with a bit of a traditional slant. This is also one of only a few places in town to find mini boba!

 Seeing other reviews advising against the milk tea, we tried the pineapple lemon green tea (a daily special) with mini boba and the kumquat tea with regular boba. The teas were both on the sweet side but not overwhelmingly so, and I really enjoyed the special. The boba were a tad softer than I would like but still better than lots of other nearby options, and slightly sweet. In the future, I would request my tea less sweet.

Location is fairly small but bright and open. Even in the middle of a weekday during my lunch break, the parking lot was packed full- I did notice a sign about additional parking around back though. Love the zebra theme, looking forward to trying a slush when I come back.

Saw their new item Black Royal on their Instagram so I went for a try. It was SO GOOD! Don't know what other words to describe it. The color after shaking it was so pretty, and the taste of it was amazing. 

Staffs were very friendly and helpful, she answered my questions and recommended me their other popular item watermelon green tea. It was so refreshing and the watermelon balanced perfectly with green tea. 

Great job!

Place was prettt near the zebra theme and cloud design is really nice it's a small place parking migt be a problem if the other stores are busy. I ordered the orange with chai seeds... the drink was ok next time I try the other flavors I'll ask for light ice... I can't hardly taste the flavor that much. But I'll be back to try the other flavors for sure... and my stars might change base on my next visit

Best tea shop in town!!! You must try all their drinks, I personally love their orange green tea which made by 100% fresh orange juice and blend well with their cold brew green tea, taste fresh and special, that is a definitely must try drink!!! The tea shop also has nice atmosphere and their interior design you don't find it that can be compare in this town, great hangout or study place to spend your afternoon here!!

DELICIOUS TEA WITH A BEAUTIFUL ATMOSPHERE!

It really has become my hidden gem of Las Vegas. A little hard to find, easy to miss, but totally worth it! I am really shocked at this store not blowing up especially with their super cool butterfly pea tea in the bottle!
Beautiful place. I tried kumquat green tea and it is great. They also have fresh orange drinks on menu, I will try it next time.
I love the green tea with any kind of fruit very very much, strongly recommend to try~

Kinda disappointing, but their other drinks are probably good. Tried the orange green tea and the strawberry green tea. Orange green tea was bitter and tasted strange, but the strawberry was ok. Dont recommend those drinks, and wish I tried something different. Friendly cashiers.

First off let me start of by saying how decor,atmosphere, and cleanliness of a shop are always a plus. Upon entering, I was welcomed by music and immediately was in awe of how cute and picturesque this place is! 

I ordered the guava green tea and it's safe to say that it's one is the best teas I've tried- completely refreshing! I normally have a problem with drinks being too overly sweet due to the large amounts of fruit syrup added but this was the perfect amount! DEF RECOMMEND. 

My sister got the Taro slush and said it was a nice balance between creaminess and flavor! They also added a scoop of actual taro in the middle of the slush which I've never seen before!

My only problem is with the coffee slush. The flavor was a bit too strong and it was dusted off with ground coffee beans which gave it a grainy/sandy taste. 

If you're ever in the area, give this place a visit!

They are located in a pretty packed plaza, but they have two designated parking spots for their customers which actually came really handy during the lunch hour. The storefront is pretty small. I could see you sitting around to catch up with friends, but this is definitely not a study spot. Like many have mentioned before, this is a zebra themed boba shop, and the decor is super cute!!

Upon entering, I was greeted by the employee behind the counter. I guess I looked pretty confused by the huge menu, so he asked me if I wanted any recommendations. I thought that was nice. They have a green tea jelly topping; in all of my boba experiences, I had never encountered it before. When I asked what it was, he tried to explain it to me--I think it would've been more effective if he just gave me a small sample.

I ordered the passion fruit green tea with boba. The drink was pretty good. You could taste the tea without it being too overpowered by the passion fruit flavoring. Their boba was soft and chewy. It had a hint of sweetness but had a weirddd aftertaste. I did not like the boba. 

The price is average. I probably will come back just to try their popular drinks before I make a final decision on this place, but I won't be ordering it with boba again.

Delicious boba! The service is fast and super nice. 10/10 I would definitely recommend people to come and check it out. Looks very stylish. Loved the zebra theme. The server Chan is very cool, nice to talk to. I received a great service so here are 5 stars for this business.  keep it up.
Bubble tea is good. I ordered olong milk tea. My husband ordered olong milk tea with boba. Their boba is Q ~~ it tastes really good. I will definitely get boba next time. Also, the place is clean.

One of the best boba and tea places in the city. Their teas are great and especially their slushy drinks when it gets hot outside. Try the watermelon, amazon, and royal milk teas. 

The interior is kinda nice but not great for big groups. Also can't really sit and chill to do work here, mostly to-go. 

The service is fast but the staff don't really talk too much. Could be friendlier but I guess the drinks make up for it.

I loveeeeee this place! It is super cute inside, everyone is super nice, and the drinks are so delicious... their AMAZON drink is seriously my fav drink/slushie ever definitely a must try.. mmm I believe it's passionfruit + kiwi slushie with shredded boba.. and the peach slushie w/ boba is really tasty too.. I just wish there was one in Henderson  ...(totally craving an Amazon right now )

The interior design is pretty creative and I really liked it. I'm really into tea flavor and not the flavors and syrups. My gf and I usually only get jasmine milk tea at other places. We thought this place was ok. A little more creamer than I prefer. I wish they had wifi. I thought all milk tea places offer wifi, is that only a California thing?

We came back on our next trip to Vegas and it's good to see they have a better system for service with the same great taste.

The tea was made individually and was very authentic. The texture and sweetness of the boba was perfectly cooked and just the right amount. Cute decor, definitely lives up to the Z in zebra. We ordered 5 drinks, the wait was a little long but was very much worth the wait.

It was my first time getting boba from here and had a GREAT experience! Not only is there a large variety of menu items but they tasted great as well. Don't forget to check in on their Facebook page or Yelp for 10% off. Ample parking is also an added bonus. I will definitely be coming back!

Mr.Z was great!!!! The place is so cute inside and there are so many options!!! I got the pineapple apple tea with boba and it was so delicious and refreshing! I can't wait to come back and try everything on the menu.

Mr. Z is probably my go-to for watermelon slush. They use real watermelon during peak season, so you are guaranteed that it is fresh. The miniboba is also one of my faves here just because it is sweet but not overwhelmingly covered in syrup. My friends also seemed to like the place! We had watermelon slush, house milk tea, oolong tea, and guava tea. The selection of teas are really great :).

I also like how they made the place very homey and cute. There is a grass area and an area perfect for pictures and to hang out.

Okay so my first experience here was not that great due to poor service, so I gave them 2 stars. After a few months, I wanted to give this place another shot, so I went in twice and overall experience was okay. 

But not until the last time I went last week. I believe it was last Saturday around 8pm and when I came in there were few employees including a short  hair lady and I was the only customer there. Trust me, I was being very nice to them by thanking them when I got the order and the short haired lady DID NOT respond me at all and gave me an attitude. I believe she was the one who did not take care of me on my first visit (refer to my previous review). 

Wow I was so dumbfounded. And instantly thought this place is not going to work for me at all, because of the very poor service. I don't care how good their drinks are, they need to work on customer service, period. I felt so humilating and dissapointing. WILL NOT GO BACK!!!!!

This place is the real deal. No nasty flavor powders here! I can actually taste the tea in the drinks!!!! Oolong milk tea is my favorite. They also let you choose how sweet and how much ice!! Perfect!! The fruit drinks use real fruit, not syrups. This is the closest thing to Taiwan and blows away any of the other tea spots in town! 

The people working there are super nice too. Quick service. Nothing to complain about here!

Price is average. Clean & nice/cute environment. Really good customer svs. Rain was very helpful & pleasant. I ordered a oolong milk tea with mini bobas & it tasted amazing. I will definitely be going back.

This boba stop is a very cute and fun environment. We got some boba after eating dim sum and loved the overall atmosphere and feel of this place; very clean and modern in decor. The drinks we ordered did take a little long to make because their was only one barista working the front of the store but we were in no rush. 

We ordered a Wintermelon milk tea and my boyfriend ordered some fufu juice tea that I cannot recall. All I know is the my drink was tasty and we both finished our drinks in a very timely manner. Their boba was sweet from the honey and not under or over cooked. It had a good consistency in the tapioca.. The boba is one of the main ways I rate a boba shop; and it did not disappoint. 

The Wintermelon milk tea had a perfect balance of being sweet and bitter from the taste of the tea. I cannot drink milk tea that taste like milk and sugar like some other shops.. 

Overall, would definitely come to this place again.

Wow one of the best boba places that I've been to in Las Vegas! I ordered the yogurt butterfly pea drink and it was delicious. It also came in a super cute bottle that was really pretty when the ingredients were layered. The taste is very unique and is also not caffeinated. I also tried the watermelon tea and they use fresh watermelon juice to make it. Very refreshing and tasty!

Great selection and friendly service! We just moved to Vegas from Chicago and Mr. Z was on our bucket list. Small but ultra modern store front and the staff was very knowledgeable about all their offerings. Definitely will return and the Kiwi smoothie was amazing!!!

The Amazon is to die for!! Fire!! I never had a passion fruit slushee that amazing! The barista is great and friendly. I wish this tea shop open up in SoCal. I love it so much!! This is my new go to when I'm back in Vegas.

Mr. Z is located next to Hong Kong Garden Dim Sum and Sushi Takashi. My friend and I visited Mr. Z on 8/18. Mr. Z is in the soft opening phase with the grand opening coming shorty per the cashier. Unfortunately the full menu is not available yet. Only menu items were standard powder slushes and a few milk teas. I got an oolong milk tea with no sugar and boba. The milk tea was decent. The boba is not cooked in longan honey like other shops however it is still slightly sweet. I'd like to try the Wintermelon oolong tea and the chrysanthemum tea when available. The interior is simple with the store having a zebra theme(hence Mr.Z) but one significant improvement is needed. Please get a garbage receptacle! Also Mr. Z doesn't have stamp cards. Las Vegas has gotten many boba shops recently and I wish Mr. Z. best of luck.

Z is for zebra. 

No, really. This is a zebra themed boba cafe! Super cute decor-- I love everything from the fake grass on the ground to the giant zebra painted on the wall. This place is very instagram worthy. 

Now on to the important stuff... the drinks!

I had the red bean milk tea. I never had a red bean drink before, so I have nothing to compare it to but I thought it was tasty. It was just the right amount of sweetness. There was a good amount of red bean at the bottom of the cup, too. Delish! The boba was sweet and chewy. I would definitely order this drink again. In my opinion, I thought that the prices were a little high but then again this place made better drinks than some of the other popular boba places in the area. There are two drink sizes. We ordered one large and one regular and it came out to about $10ish after you add boba. Not including tip for the tip jar.

We came here around 8pm on a weekend night and this place was empty. The employees were helpful and brought out our drinks to our table, instead of just calling our names to pick it up. It is also very clean inside. Definitely a place you can hang out for a bit and enjoy your tea. I will be back!

This place is extremely underrated. (Not that it's really a complaint. I don't mind having to wait to get my yummy drinks!) Everything I have gotten here has been top quality. There's so many different types of drinks to try and I've not been let down a single time. (I am here quite regularly.)

This is my favorite milk tea place. I ordered watermelon green tea. I saw they use real watermelon. And they brew green tea leaf to make green tea, instead of whatever powder other places use. The tea tastes very good and the place is clean. Highly recommended!

Cam here twice during our vacation and I have to say and maybe be wrong, but the best tea / boba place in Vegas.  First time I came, I got the Amazon (passion fruit with kiwi syrup and diced boba), yes, diced boba.  It was very good and a must get.  The second time, I got one of their bottle tea.  Comes in 3 flavors and I got the grapefruit one.  My friend got the orange juice ones.  What makes this place great is that it is all made fresh.  You can hear me squeezing the juices from real fruit and they take their time in making each one.  They menu is unique with different flavors.  This will be my go to place.  The workers friendly too.

Instaaaa-worthy ! Super cute spot with colorful teas and  fun cloud and zebra decors! 

A great place to grab an afternoon drink. Limited seating but good place for photos. The butterfly pea drink was purple and coral, price was about $6.

I've been trying to visit this place for quite awhile and finally made the trip this past weekend. Mr. Z lived up to the hype by not only serving pretty drinks but they taste delicious too! My friend and I got the butterfly Pea teas in orange and grapefruit and they were divine. As a tea fan i found it we a great blend of floral, fruity and sweet, while my friend (who isn't a tea fan in the slightest) found it to also be refreshing. 

I'll be returning every chance i get!

Not gonna lie, I decided to try this place out because of an appealing photo I saw on a Las Vegas foodie Instagram account! I ordered the Butterfly Pea Tea with fresh squeezed orange juice. The OJ gave the drink the right amount of sweetness, needless to say that the two make a delicious combination! I wasn't sure about the chia seeds at first, but I actually loved the little bit of texture it gave the drink. I'll have to come back to try the yogurt flavor with the Butterfly Pea tea!

It was a good plays and there service was not so bad
I will come again to visit 
Will tell my frens and famliy........................
My boy Ray hooked it up. Special made a lychee passion fruit slush for me. Come here for a refreshing drink and check in on Yelp. Get that 10% off.

I'm a big boba fan, so when I hear that a new boba place will be opening up I get really excited! 
I have a very high standard of what boba places should be (guess I'm really picky). 

When I entered the staff was okay. They weren't bored nor where they too happy to see me (in comparison with tea space. They're always ecstatic!) I believe that in order to make great drinks you have to be in a great mood! 

I ordered the red bean slush, it was okay. Nothing special. To me the drink itself was the definition of "meh" 

The place overall is nice to hang around at. The smell really doesn't bother me that much, though a lot of people don't like it. The size of this place is what really got me! It's bigger than most boba places which I like! It's nice and spacious unlike Kung Fu Tea, so you're not overwhelmed. 

Overall I give this a 3 because it's nothing too special nor too bad!

I ordered the taro slushie w/ boba and I'm basing my review on this drink. Boba wasn't as soft as I like it and my drink didn't have much flavor. It was more like blended ice and a hint of taro :( I've had better!
Great service. Came here today for the first time and the staff was kind enough to help me with what i should order which was just the perfect milk tea for my taste.

Stopped in here after some dim sum for more caffeine (because really who can't get enough of that). The decor is really simple and sweet. I couldn't resist touching the fuzzy cloud or writing my bf's name on the wall. They have a lot of different toppings for your tea. Although the boba is your typical tapioca. The barista explained their specials going on between the pineapple watermelon green tea or their regular watermelon green tea. The latter being more refreshing and the first being sweeter. (No samples though, since "they make the drinks fresh") I went with the second choice. They used real watermelon juice and it tasted great with the aloe topping. It was fun to chew. Good price, nice setting. Needs better parking though.

We stopped by here while we were in Vegas during Christmas.  I got the Jasmine milk tea and it was very delicious.  The tea flavor is very smooth and I definitely enjoyed it.  

Plenty of parking spaces.

They do offer stamp card!!

Friendly services.

Cute place since it's zebra themed. Reminds me of Boba Guys in San Francisco with their design. I love how the cups have a design on them. Wasn't really that impressed due to the boba and drink tasting like any regular one I could get anywhere. Cafe is also smaller than expected. Overall it's a cute idea but it's just there. It needs something else in order to make it spark up among the other places in Vegas.

Decided to stop by for a drink on a hot day!  

Was greeted by a gentleman.  I asked him regarding a grape slush I saw on yelp, and he said that it was seasonal, so it's not available or on the menu.  

He was really helpful with asking what kind of drink I was looking for. I told him i wanted something fruity.  He explained the difference and what was in the fruit tea.  Then while looking at the top 10, I noticed one called "AMAZON" so I asked him what it was.  And he explained it was passionfruit blended, along with boba!  It sounded really refreshing, so I went ahead and ordered it.

My husband ordered the watermelon green tea as that was the seasonal drink.  My mom ordered Amazon, but wanted only 25% sugar, as she's diabetic.

They took a while to make the drinks, putting love into each drink they produce.  The watermelon green tea was really refreshing.  Had the taste of fresh watermelon juice, then an after taste of green tea.  very interesting!  Even recommended Aloe as a topping.

The Amazon looked SOOO pretty, bright yellow, with pieces of black boba floating around (it tastes so awesome when it's frozen with the slush).  Had a strong taste of passionfruit.  Perfect tartness and refreshing flavour.  

My mom's amazon tasted just as good, I thought without the sugar, it would just taste sour, but no, it was just as refreshing without all that sugar.  Awesome place, and nice decoration!  

Thanks for the great service and drink

Friendly service but I did notice some powders that were on the back wall. I know some places offer real taro/ no powder. Prices are competitive with other local spots. Cute zebra themed things on the wall and counter. There isn't much seating, but its a bright and open space so I think it would be good for doing some homework (if you come in the morning when its not busy). I'm not sure if they offer wifi or not. 

I'm not a huge fan of oolong milk tea BUT, this place has THE BEST oolong milk tea that I've had in a while. Definitely coming back here if I'm craving some Oolong milk tea. For some reason I felt that their large drinks are a bit smaller than other spots... I could be wrong though.

First time in here and we ordered the pudding milk tea/green milk tea. I guess I expected it to be really good thats why we both end up getting disappointed. The boba pearls itself is a lil soggy (maybe because we showed up an 1hr 30mins before closing) Im not really picky about boba pearls tho but just the milk tea itself. Its not very tasty. Its just sweet and has that watery taste. 



The workers are very nice though and helpful. The place is cute and they offer stampcards. Ill probably give this place another try!

Once again, another boba shop has sprouted in Vegas. 
I think I was more attracted to their zebra logo because it reminds me of the ant eater logo of Boba Guys in San Francisco. Well my friend and I came in on a slow day and to be honest, it was such an awkward interaction. I really do enjoy the way they decorated the inside though!
Anyways, I got the green milk tea and she got the taro milk tea.
I didn't find anything too special about the boba or drink because it tasted watered down. I've been planning on trying their other drinks, but I keep delaying my next visit as well. Overall, I'll definitely give it another try so I'll update my review later on before being too judgmental.
Good tea selections and the server was very accommodating when we wanted to split one drink into two cups. We just wanted to try the slushee and it was a nice refresher after a heavy meal nearby.

Wowwww! Such a cute place. The decor is super cute and bright and colorful! I always loved that about certain places that serve boba!! Any picture you take will come out great. The lighting is great and I was greeted as soon as I walked in. I ordered the Amazon drink. Which is passion fruit blended with boba and kiwi. The flavors of this drink are amazing! My boyfriend ordered the weirdest thing it was a pineapple apple tea. His looked really chunky with thick pineapple purée sitting on top. I would just stick to their drink options than making your own mix. I definitley will return now that it's summer time I'll be stopping and getting the Amazon drink to cool off!

I was thirsty on a weekend, and came by this cute store called Mr. Z. The staff was extremely friendly and were very helpful on the drinks. I ordered Oolong milk tea. The tea was made just right with right amount of milk. Was glad I found this golden gem. Will come back!

Honestly I don't get the hype. At 8:15 pm on a Sunday, the place was completely empty so service was quick and the drink was made in 5 minutes. That's the only plus I can see, because otherwise the boba was awful and the drink was bland. 

I ordered a grapefruit green tea with 50% sweetness, less ice, and added on chia seeds and boba. Apparently, less sweetness means less syrup because it tasted really watery. The chia seeds were fine, but the boba was bad -- very little boba, and all the balls had this weird gooey-ness around the outside of them as if they had just been sitting around at the bottom of a pot full of boiled water all day...honestly really gross. All this disappointment cost me a little less than $6.

I won't be back. There's a ton of other boba places nearby that taste a lot better.
Not sure what's better, the decor or the taste of the teas! To the girl who was knocking back like 7 drinks by herself: you are killin it!
I had the royal milk tea and it was awesome! Great service and friendly staff. Highly recommend.

I was very happy to have visited this spot! The staff was extremely kind and helpful. The decor is perfectly quaint and fun. I got a great milk tea with bobs and appreciated the loyalty card as well. Definitely want to come back!

2 words: WATERY DRINKS
Came here on a saturday night around 10 pm and they closed at 11pm.
It was EMPTY and we were the only customers (myself and my friends) Only saw one person working there and she was closing up (cleaning) and the barista.

Ambience was modern and cutie. The decor was 5/5. Fluffy life like clouds hung from the ceiling all around the store. A couple chairs that looked very hipster. LARGE painting of a zebra on the wall. And all along the table were cute knick knacks (some of which were zebras as well) Overall the inside was eye catching!

DRINK: Mr. Z black milk tea with boba (medium,50% sweet) $3.75
Ok so I know it's the end of the day, they are about an hour from closing, and it's empty but my drink was straight just WATER with a hint of milk and tea, the boba was chewy but obviously did not taste fresh and was end of the day material but it was OK. However the drink was terrible, no taste whatsoever. Not sure how she made the drink to be that watery. It tasted like she put a spoonful of tea. A cup of milk and filled the rest with water. 

Very disappointed with the quality of their drinks since it had good reviews. My experience may have been different if I went earlier in the day but I think it is disappointing how low grade their drinks are when it's past 10 pm.

Mr. Z... Please tell me - what a zebra, a brick wall, and cotton clouds have in common?

Okay the zebra caught my attraction factor. Cutesy displays of zebras everywhere. We had to try them at least once. Smells earthy when walking in. Fake grass... Wanna have a picnic? 

I like the menu. Too much ice in our Taro milk tea Honey milk tea with boba. Next time should get a smoothie or blended kind instead. 

Price to size comp; pricier than OMG Boba. However, did enjoy the zebra theme. And although not sure of the correlation between zebras and teas, there is a tea focus: green tea, oolong, black tea. All supposed to be good for you. 

...Answer: Their patterns are never the same ;)

Cute little tea shop located in the Cathay Hills plaza. This place used to be a piano studio where I received piano lessons. Very nostalgic! 

Their symbol/theme is a zebra, hence the name Mr. Z Tea Co. I found that quite comical and random, but hey, it works. They have this awesome mural of Mr. Z the Zebra on their wall. Employees are friendly, and the drinks are super refreshing. The kiwi slushy, which was their weekly special, was on fleek. Please bring that back or put it on the menu permanently!

Newly opened boba tea house from LA located in the middle of Chinatown. When we stepped in, we were greeted with all of those smiling faces right away. The menu is very simple. Besides the regular cold tea drink, there are many fresh squeezed fruits and tea drinks. 
I love my fresh watermelon tea. I actually tasted the Oolong tea and the watermelon . We also tried the peach and mango, which was amazing. Unlike other places where each drink tastes all the same, Mr Z's  each drink actually tastes just like its flavor. Mango is mango, peach is peach, etc etc.... There are many employees and they put out the drinks quickly. Strongly recommend MR Z for those tired paying more $$ just for the sweet ice water. Ask for Yolo, she is so knowledgable about all the menus.

First time I came, I really liked my Green Milk tea with Boba. It was so good that I wanted to come back again and try something new.

Just came back and got an Oolong milk tea. Unfortunately they only had mini boba, which I said was fine. But it wasn't because it was too soft!! Not Chewy at all!!!! I really like my boba kinda chewy but there's a certain texture that is just right, and this was like.. melt in my mouth but not in a good way. Sigh.  

So I think the teas do taste good but the mini boba may be inconsistent. :(  And I didn't know they offered a stamp card! I looked around but didn't see anything saying they had a card, and I shouldv'e asked but usually those things are advertised and we were never asked if we wanted one.

Cute boba place, but that's about it. Came here after lunch and tried their iced green milk tea with boba. Boba was not cooked well and was still on the hard side. Iced milk tea tasted like iced water. Not sure how this place has 4.5 stars. I say save your $5 and go somewhere else instead.

I just had pho and needed a drink pick me up before class. This was on the way to campus so here I am

Really cute concept being zebra/zoo themed. Since there's a lot of boba joints throughout town it seems like all drinks are the same. 

I got their oolong milk tea with egg pudding. The egg pudding was good and didn't have a weird powdery film texture to it. Definitely full of tea goodness!! 

I forgot to ask for less sweet but i didn't need it so that's awesome!  Nice and creamy. It was kinda slow and quiet so when all your favorite coffee shops and boba joints packed, I'd come here to study.

But since it's so far I probably would stick to my normal boba joint. But I would def come back when convenient.

I love love love their Mr. Z iced coffee!!! So delicious~~ I finished the drink in 3 minutes. Great ambience and friendly staff! I would recommend Mr. Z to all my friends and family~ Mr. Z is definitely my cup of tea!

The first time I walked in the staff were nice! So much to choose. They were nice to go through the menu with me. Tried the apple tea and taro smoothie. Loved it of course!! This time I came try the Amazon!! I love kiwi and pomegranate with brought me to love it!! It's fruity and refreshing. If you are around China town stop by and try it. Plus Who doesn't love zebras!  Best place to have a drink and be around zebra decors.

Definitely have to come check out this place. It's a funky little spot one of a kind. Just loved it, the staff was nice and helpful. The drinks were not only really cool but really good i wish i could have one every day. I had gotten the orange butterfly pea tea and it was so refreshing made with fresh orange juice and chia seeds such a unique flavor.

I had some time to kill after lunch so went with a friend to Mr. Z, which was in the same plaza as our lunch place.

The interior was small but most boba places aren't big. The menu wasn't too big, but offered most of the typical items you would expect.

I got a stamp card and prices were average. Service was decent.

All in all, a solid boba place. Nothing really stood out to me, but a good option if you are in the area and craving boba.
The place is super awesome. Products are delicious and employees are extremely friendly and nice. Employee Harrison is super handsome. Love love love, the place. Will definitely be going back.

Great as always, their tea are never a disappointment. Fun Zebra theme must be the reason I keep coming back. Aside from the zebra theme they like to change up there decors depending on the holiday. 

I went in at 12 noon and had the whole place to myself. Pretty chill, ordered my passion green tea and enjoyed every last sip. 

I recommend every to give it a try. Definitely returning for more.

It's a medium size boba shop. Very similar to kung fu tea in my opinion . I tried their pineapple lemon drink if I can recall but it's nice the seating is small but the decor is pretty cute. I would have to visit a few more times to see if I like it any better than the other boba shops.

After reading all the rave reviews, I decided to check this place out. I was a little bummed out that they didn't have Thai Tea (it's my favorite) or the Strawberry Wonderland Slush I had seen on their Instagram.

I opted for Almond Milk Tea, which was good, but not my first choice. I also went near closing time, and noticed they had "sold out" written on some of the photos. 

Their boba was a little bit harder than what I'm used to. I will have to come back and try their other flavors and toppings.

Also, it's a super cute place. I love the zebra decor.

We went here after eating pho next door. Drinks were pretty good but what really sold it for me was the interior. It was like its own little world. The lights were clouds, there was fake grass and even a cross walk to the register. Loved the vibe of the store and wish I can come back. I got the pineapple green tea  I liked it a lot. Light and fresh exactly what I wanted during a hot day. 

Service: 5/5
Drinks: 5/5
Interior: 5/5
Price: $

There seems to be a new boba place opening up every other week. I finally had the chance to try this place and I was not disappointed (I didn't actually get boba though). This little shop is so cute. I'm obsessed with the way it's decorated. It's simple and clean. There wasn't anyone there when I came, which I like. I hate when places are always packed. 

Anyways, I got the pudding milk tea (green tea) and it was just the right amount of sweetness for me. I ordered the mango slushie for my bf and it was pretty good. Not the best I've ever had but it wasn't bad. I'll definitely have to come back and try other drinks. And plus you get 10% off when you check in on Yelp!

Okay so first off I wanted to say that I'm a bobaholic... I've worked at a boba cafe before and been to so many boba shops that I know what's bomb and what's not. But oh man this place was SOO GOOD I got Taro Milk Tea with lychee jelly and I'm obsessed!!

If I still lived in Vegas, I'd be frequenting this place on the reg. With the blazing summer temps out here, I'm always on the lookout for a refreshing drink that will make me momentarily forget I'm visiting an oven. Mr. Z's watermelon green tea is THAT DRINK. A fusion of fresh watermelon juice and green tea, lightly sweetened, and handed to you with a smile, this is a definite winner at Mr. Z.

Their cute little boba shop is the absolute cutest! I live for anything cute, especially this little shop. We went in not knowing what to order, but the people working being the counter made it a lot easier for us to decide. Their menu is detailed, they have little examples of how it will appear in your choice of order up near the cash register, thought that was helpful. Overall, the drinks are pretty amazing. Will go again.

I came here this past week and was very impressed with the quality of ingredients and tea I got here. The atmosphere is welcoming and modern and makes a good date spot. I had the winter melon tea, which is hard to find in Vegas. You can tell that they don't use artificial flavors and stick to natural and organic. Also, the boba is among the best I've had - the right consistency and still retains the right sweetness of honey. I'd definitely come back!

I loved this place.  One of my goals while in Vegas was to find a new boba place and this was my choice.  I had originally come for the guava green tea, but found out the guava is just flavoring.  Luckily, they did have a menu of real fruit drinks.

Their most advertised real fruit drinks was the watermelon green tea and it was the one the owners recommended, so that's what I went with.  I'm really glad as I did as it was exactly what I wanted.  I watched them make it and they used multiple pieces of fresh watermelon for my drink.  They were able to find the perfect balance between the watermelon and the green tea, with both equally prominent and balanced.  I got it half sweet and it was just right.  It was super refreshing.

I also tried their pineapple apple green tea, also half sweet.  The drink was a bit more tart and a bit more sweet than I was expecting, but it was still quite good.  They again managed to balance the flavors of pineapple, apple, and green tea without any one component overpowering the others.  I was pretty surprised by this since it would have been so easy for the pineapple to take over.

The boba itself was perfectly made.  It was sweetened just right and had a great texture.  They also did something I've never seen anyone do at a boba shop.  The person who made my drinks actually used a tasting spoon to taste each drink before serving to me.  Impressive!

The owners are two sisters from Taipei and they're really nice.  The store is very inviting and there's plenty of space to sit down at a table or stand at the counter.

I ended up getting another watermelon green tea before leaving since I loved it so much.  Mr. Z's was exactly what I was hoping to find.  As the weather gets hotter, these fresh fruit and tea drinks will get more and more satisfying.

Next time I'm in Vegas, I know I'll be stopping by Mr. Z's.

Love love this place. Fun vibe place chill great drinks. Employees all that have helped are great, wish I could have got name of this one awesome employee male, always doing homework on laptop when I go in ( great customer service) 

Drinks: highly recommend AMAZON & KIWI SLUSHI 

If you have tried this place keep going, if you haven't you got to go!

I got a green milk tea with mini boba, and it was great! The drinks were just right and not too sweet or too milky the way kft makes it. They're one of the only places in town that has mini boba too! The service was friendly too, but I asked the girl working what made the Mr. Z drinks different or special and she didn't really know how to answer me. I'd recommend checking this place out regardless though!

I tried this place for the first time the other day, and I definitely want to go back. They had so many interesting flavors I wanted to try, but I stuck with my normal Taro milk tea. It had a cute theme inside, the staff were really friendly, and the wait for your drinks wasn't long.

Really nice tea spot. The place is modernly decorated with a chill atmosphere. They've got lots of different tea and add on choices. We ordered the watermelon green tea with aloe (out of this world good) and pineapple with boba. Delicious and service was friendly.

Mr. Z Tea co found me on Instagram I took a look at there profile and I said looks interesting so I decided to investigate this place. I drove up to the place and they had reserved parking for the customers a plus. So I walked in side I was greeted immediately when I walked in side. It was a genuine greeting unlike the fake greetings you get in are town. The environment was really cool and calming not to loud and the sound track was some smooth R&B jams at a nice volume. I ordered the Orange butterfly. This drink was really refreshing i normally Gulp my drinks down but this one had a different taste to it after a few sips I enjoyed it. Something really different. I will go back in the future to see how there boba taste.
Mr. Z is a really chilling spot, and I love the oolong milk tea!!! Plus the nice and friendly service!!!

Went to grab some bubble tea after eating Japanese food. Wasn't expecting too much but was fantastically surprised by how good the green milk tea was. I was impressed enough to leave a review. Very strong green tea flavor. Ordered 50% sugar and was actually that - not too sweet. 

The shop itself is quite cute - lots of zebras everywhere. The man working was very nice and friendly.  He samples all the drinks to make sure it tastes good.

To be honest, this place is creative and very cute inside. Aside from the Zebra theme, they also like to change up their decors depending on the Holidays!! I love Mango green tea with boba in here, that's a reason why I keep coming back.

I really wanted to like this place but I don't!!! Worst service ever. Put my ordered in, 15 minutes later still no drinks. I asked the worker how many more minutes do I have to wait she said 10 min. Can I please just have my money back please. The end. Never coming back.

Okay, so this place offers sooooo many options! I went with the milk tea! They have slushes, hot and cold tea, of course!!! I will be coming back to Mr.Z. 

Boba is .50 cents extra.

Tea was med hot, not burn your mouth hot. So I was able to drink it right away.

My drink was about $4.50 without boba but still good.

I like it because they have a orange dot by any drink you can get hot, which is really helpful!! Usually I have to ask, which drink comes warm! I stumbled upon this place on accident, it's right next to a travel place I needed to go to! Great find!

What a cute boba tea shop! I stopped in here after having dim sum next door and was so happy. I feel like there aren't enough solid drink spots in China Town area. Yes, there are a couple like King Fu and the spot in China Town Mall, but this is a welcome addition.

The place wasn't so busy, but I'm guessing it's fairly new. Their drinks are solid. I had a milk tea with pudding and it was delicious. Their boba is well made: chewy and not hard in the middle while also not being over cooked. They have hot drinks and cold drinks with a focus on hot teas. 

The decor is so cute. They have zebra stuff every where and positive little quotes. The windows give it a welcome and warm feeling. I seriously took like 50 pictures in here. 

The cashier worked alone and made all of our drinks very timely. She even talked to us about the owner's idea for the place and how some of the fixtures were house made.

I really liked that it wasn't busy, that it was fun to be in, and that I got four drinks with add one for less than $20 bucks. 

PS there's ample parking ahem Kung Fu plaza..

This place isn't that good, apparently everyone who gave this place 5 stars has never had boba before.  Furthermore the cashier looked very miserable with everything and put the incorrect condiments in the wrong drinks, and when I told him about it he just scooped everything out with a spoon.  This place is only hyped up due to the bottles. The taste was terrible, the cashier looked miserable, I can see why  the place was empty.

What do a Large Zebra painting,Cotton Ball hanging clouds and a red brick chalk autograph wall have in common?= DRINKS. I love, love, love the fresh fruit Kiwi Slushy!!! The taste is pure and doesn't taste artificial.The Pineapple Apple Green Tea and the Watermelon Pineapple Green Tea made with fresh fruit are both so refreshing and delish. My husband's Peach Slushy was not as yummy to us as the drinks listed above. I appreciate the usage of fresh fruit as many Drink/Boba places use powders to flavor their drinks. I just wish Mr. Z Tea Co wasn't so far away from me. The Centennial Hills area would welcome Mr. Z Tea Co with open arms!!!!

Awesome innovative drinks with a welcoming vibe and friendly staff! My top favorites are definitely the not so secret menu's black royal milk tea and watermelon green tea. Extremely refreshing for those hot desert days.

P.S.
Great spot for those insta-worthy posts.

A+ for the drinks that ARE NOT boba. 
I tried several of the fruit teas and they were awesome. They weren't overly sweet and they tasted fresh. Heavier on the fruit than the tea, but I have no complaints. Grab a stampcard to start collecting! 
Boba on the other hand, was pretty bad. The boba wasn't very chewy, had no taste and the milk tea came out a little watered down. Not happy with that drink, but everything else was great! 
Parking isn't too bad in the plaza. There are 2 spots specifically for Mr. Z and for pick up orders only. There are a couple of tables and seats, but not meant for huge crowds!

After having dinner at rincon de buenos aires my buddy had noticed that the rest of this plaza was fairly dead. Being the curious guy that he is, he spotted Mr. Z Tea Co and was saying how this could be a secret gem, a mecca of boba deliciousness. To me, Mr. Z sounds like a weird name for a boba place. Like Mr. Z computer repair or Mr. Z kids store sound more appropriate but lets see how it is. 

Setting: Already stated pretty dead plaza minus rincon, the store itself still smells like construction with ok seating but not really for hanging around at. Business seems very slow since when we walked in, the employees went to the back and turned the thermostat on lol (must be the owner's kids). I don't like that the garbage can's have lids that you have to pick up to throw away your boba, more work, makes my hands dirty. 

Drinks: The employee wasn't sure of a lot of the drinks and just said "oh yeah thats good, oh that's good, yes that is very good" I know it's a business but as a picky consumer i like honesty. My friend got the chocolate milk which was just powdered chocolate and coconut milk, pretty disappointing. I got the amazon which was passion fruit plus a kiwi syrup swirl and shredded boba. This was quite refreshing and the idea of shredded boba is an awesome idea. More boba places should think about having shredded boba as an option since people like myself hate having to anticipate the whole boba and then chewing chewing on it...

Overall: I'm not sure about the future of this place... It's really quite dead and to travel this deep into chinatown for boba when you already pass so many other ones. It's tough to say if Mr. Z will survive.

This would be my second go to favorite place if I'm ever in Chinatown. The ice to drink ratio is perfect and the drinks they serve are extensive. My personal favorite is the black royal milk tea, the fiancé loves to get the amazon. The boba is cooked perfectly and the customer service is great! Wish the stamp card was a little smaller so I can achieve getting a drink after a couple stamps

Love this  place!! 
Wish they had Mr. Z tea company in California. 
So delicious. I would highly recommend watermelon  green tea & amazon with jelly.
Quality Boba and tea. Can't wait to come back and try all the different menu items, they have a lot to options besides milk tea

How can you say no to boba?! 
Mr. Z Tea is pretty amazing.  We decided to try this place out after eating at Hwaro.  TYJ that we decided to because we were going to leave.  So its located in Chinatown and theres lots of parking.  We got there around 9pm.  There was only one group in there but also one worker.  They also do yelp delivery!!! Anyways, they do have a variety of drinks.  I wanted to try the butterfly pea tea because I always love getting the souvenir bottles from boba places.  She recommended the yogurt.  She said the grapefruit was more on the bitter side fyi.  I did get the yogurt.  When i took a sip of it i twitched a little because it was so sour.  Make sure to shake it before you drink!!! Lol she does at a squirt of lemon at the top.  My mistake :p but the yogurt was amazing!! It also looked so pretty & it has chia seeds inside for a little texture.  My friend got the amazon which is a mixture of pssionfruit, kiwi, and other fruits and she loved it.  Go try the Butterfly Pea teas before they are gone!

I got a LARGE SIZE GRAPE FRUIT SLUSHIE, it's not because I am thirsty, it's because regular size is not enough, it's THAT GOOD! It made with fresh grapes and tasted just so perfect. This is the ONLY tea place I go when I am in Vegas, it's a great place to hang with friends and it also cures my hangover from the night before! LOVE IT AND HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!
Best tea house in vegas! Boba is nice and chewy. The tea is amazing as well. Not too sweet. Has just the right flavor. Amazing gem in vegas!! Highly recommend.

MR. Z TEA~

CUSTOMER SERVICE: 5/5. There was only one person working when we got here. The interior here is really cute with all the zebras and clouds. The cashier was really helpful with recommendations and patient with us changing our minds. She made all of our drinks!

PRICES: 5/5.
$3 for most small drinks
$4 for most large drinks

HONEY GREEN MILK TEA: 5/5. I asked for it to be a little bit more sweet than usual and it was perfect. Not too sweet and I could actually taste the tea. Definitely a solid drink and something I'd recommend.

WATERMELON GREEN TEA: 5/5. SO REFRESHING. Tastes like I just cut open a watermelon and blended it. It was sweet and really cooling.

BOBA: 5/5. The boba here was so good. It was the perfect consistency and tasted fresh. Not too chewy or too hard. I got the mini boba and I wish I could just have a full cup of it!

OVERALL: 5/5. Great drinks. Great service.

I have been looking for a good boba place in Vegas for a long time, but has never found a satisfactory one, until I came to Mr. Z. 

The workers are friendly, the decor is trAndy, comfortable, but not threatening

If you were happened to be looking for a boba place in Vegas, this is it.  I highly recommend be watermelon green tea.  It has all the freshness and tastiness of a real watermelon, yet preserve the "fresh" taste of the fruit

I know I will be coming back here often!

YELP lead me here! Was looking for a tea shop something more quaint and small than a generic Starbucks. This was the place this little tea shop is by china town it's very small intimate and great for a first date or a meeting with a friend. Perfect for chatting wont be noise and you may be able to get some work done if that's what your looking for. Didn't really check to see if Wi-Fi was free but I assume so since various people had their laptop. 

I love the name, there's several small zebras(made out of wood) but it's not like safari themed. 

The price is very affordable it's the same as a Starbucks coffee. The larger size may be 3-6 dollars depending on what you get. They have slushees, teas, and coffee.

I had a guava green tea! It's was delicious and a must try. They have a "Top Ten" menu which makes it super easy to make a decision. 

Definitely a must try if you're a tea lover like I am! ;)

Continuing on my boba quest... I have seriously become addicted to boba. 

Based off of reviews I popped into Mr Z today on my lunch break. 

Mr Z is a cute little shop. A giant Zebra is painted on the wall, fake grass cover part of the floor in the establishment, and there is a huge wall of bricks on which you can write with chalk. 

I had my mind decided on what I wanted before I even walked in. Based off of reviews I knew that I wanted to try the watermelon green tea. This lunch outing had been pre planned you could say. 

My initial reaction to the drink was that it was really good. The watermelon was fresh in the tea, almost like a purée. 

The boba texture seemed off. In my opinion it was harder, more rubbery than I am used to. 

As I drank more and more I took note of a weird after taste. I couldn't narrow it down. Was it from the drink itself or that off textured boba? I made it about half way through the drink and then I tossed it. Whatever the taste was, it didn't grow on me. 

My boba quest has exposed me to many different spots. This one is not a favorite of mine. Personally, I don't think I would go back.

Such a hole in the wall boba place. Their drinks taste like they were made from real loose leaf teas. The girl here working is very helpful and the taro hot milk tea and the guava green tea are very yummy. The price is a little more compared to chain boba places, but it's totally worth it.
I tried the oolong milk tea and it was delicious. I prefer honey boba, but the service and atmosphere made up for it!

So I followed this place on Instagram and when they posted this royal black tea I just had to try it. I'm giving it a star because the tea was good, but the customer service here sucks! I was last in line, but they decided to work on previous orders and there I was a whole probably five minutes waiting to order without any acknowledgement Anyways, due to my high interest in tea I figured I'd give them the benefit of doubt and wait. Well they were done making the teas and still I was waiting, one of the guys came and looked at me like "uhhh" confused? Apparently they thought I had ordered already, eventhough I was still waiting in the counter to order....fail! When I got my order, no boba in my drinks as I had requested when I ordered. I was told, "this drink does not come with boba" I explained that I know, that's why I requested that they add boba in both of the drinks I ordered. She gave me this confused face, and I think she was going to bill me again for the boba but at this point I was over this place and told her to forget it. Not even a sorry for the wait or sorry for messing up your order, this is very disappointing as I really wanted to go here on a regular since I work nearby. I'm glad there's twenty plus boba spots to go to....

Saw my brother's friend review this place... double checked with my brother that it was legit... and...

It is! 

A Taiwanese boba shop! Their logo reminds me of Boba Guys in SF. I was recommended the watermelon green tea... it was divine!! Blended tea with real watermelon. I added boba to that... and it was so so good. Their boba was definitely up to the Bay Area Cupertino standards!

If you love the taste of traditional brewed tea but with the jazzed up toppings of boba and he'll ya, look no further. By far the best tea place I've been to without the high surgar and powdery taste. You actually taste the tea!!!

With that said, this place gets a 4* instead of 5 because of the customer service. I visit this place multiple times when I'm visiting Vegas, but each and every time the owner always seem to be in a bad mood. She seems to be there physically but not mentally. She's not mean but definitely not friendly and borderling rude at times when you ask her for recommendations or questions about the menu. 

The menu is really confusing, so if you plan on going, take a gander online prior to coming in because the menu makes no sense. They don't serve food or snacks. Only good quality flavored teas with all the toppings like boba, lychee, aloe, chia and others.  I highly recommend this place to all tea and boba lovers.
It was one of my favorites tea place for my milk tea addiction. but unfortunately it closed for the next two to three weeks. Renovations it said, new concept and vegans option too. Let us know guys.
I tried some of their drinks! My favorite is the pineapple apple drink. It's made out of real fruits which is the best. Their iced coffee is very good as well.

You're reading this and you're thinking, just another boba tea place.  Not quite. 
While Vegas has recently seen its fair share of new boba shops, they are mostly of unimpressive quality gilded with loud bells and whistles to distract you from the true meaning of a good cup of boba.  But not at Mr. Z. 

My go-to is the Mr. Z Boba Milk Tea.  It is perfectly brewed and mixed with just the right amount of milk but still perfectly sweetened.  A perfect milk tea boba shouldn't require the customer to dictate how sweet it should be; perfection is perfection.  However, if you are in favor of deciding your own fate, I mean, sweetness, Mr. Z is happy to accommodate to your liking.  And, of course, the boba itself is always fresh and perfectly al dente.  

Their Orange Green Tea and Watermelon Green Tea are also something to write to Yelp about.  I was a skeptic when I first saw it on the menu; orange juice/watermelon and green tea? What...? But don't knock it till you've tried it!  Something about the mild tendency of green tea flavor makes me wonder why I haven't heard or thought of these kinds of combinations before. And while I can't confirm if it's fresh squeezed orange juice, it most certainly tasted like it!  

The decor inside is simple chic with a zebra wall decor so huge that if you don't pay attention, you will actually miss it! There is something about Mr. Z in both its drinks and decor that soothingly amplify simple chic elegance. 

Located in the smack of Chinatown on Spring Mountain, right next to the Hong Kong Garden dim sum place; it doesn't get more convenient than this.  Worry about parking in that God-awful parking lot, you say?  No worries, there are two Mr. Z's patrons-only parking spots right in front, so park away and enjoy some tea at Mr. Z!

Came here when they opened around 11ish. It was a cold day so I was craving for a hot boba drink. Their boba wasn't ready at the time when I came, so I was disappointed. They also microwave their hot drink instead of steaming it. The taste of their tea was a bit on the light side
This place has some amazing tea, get the mango slush and it's very light in taste, highly recommend

Fave milk tea place in Las Vegas. And they even have mini bobas! What an A+ music playlist. I love how cute and cozy the place is. The staff are also kind and nice. Try their Butterfly Peas! Grapefruit's my personal fave and it goes so well with the fruit tea. And don't forget to ask for stamp cards! Trust me, you'll keep on coming back. Been a customer for over a year now and still loving it!

You get the best of both worlds at Mr. Z's Tea Company. You can take the most Instagram worthy picture, then drink a delicious drink as you edit your picture. After coming here for over a year, it's time for a review. It's a smaller cafe with limited seating areas; therefore, I would recommend skipping it for a study session and get the drink to-go. The decor is so, so cute. It's themed after zebras so there's a huge mural and zebra figures on the tables and bar seating. To make it even better, it's located in a less busy plaza on Spring Mountain and there are two designated parking areas up front. There are so many unique drinks. My favorite include the red bean milk tea with mini boba (yes, mini boba!), the butterfly yogurt pea (comes in a fancy container with chia seeds), and the watermelon green tea (normally not a fan of watermelon, but this drink is so refreshing). After trying so many boba joints throughout Las Vegas, this is definitely on my top two of favorites. Despite the fact that it's quite the drive from where I reside, I'm still here at least a couple times a week. Give this place a try, you won't regret it!
This is the first and last place we go to when we come in and leave LV. Look no further for Royal MT, this is the place to go.

The AMAZON is one drink you can't miss to try! Kiwi and passion fruit slush with blended boba.  I enjoy how the boba is blended into the drink compared to the usual. Makes it unique and this drink was also tasty and refreshing. Their honeydew milk tea, super yummy and pure tasting. As compared to other competitors teas being sugary and powdery. Mr. Z TEA CO got it good! 

They offer various milk teas, slushes, and drinks. Get a stamp card and for every 10 you get a free drink! Will be back for more if I am craving Boba! 

Very nice urban to modern like atmosphere. With their cute decor setting, you get a feel as if your out in the front porch or yard in the middle of downtown. Cool, and friendly staff. Place located in the Cathay Hills plaza on Spring mtn road. Nearby a lot of great restaurants in the area.

Mr. Z Tea Co. is located in a little plaza, which means rarely a close parking spot. BUT this boba place has two spots reserved just for them (great idea!)

The staff was very friendly and gave amazing recommendations. I was nervous to try new things, so I got my usual match slushie with boba. The boba was very chewy and soft, except for the three or four that were super hard and catch you off guard lol. The slushie, tho, didn't have as much flavor as I wanted it to be. It was more ice than matcha. My adventurous sister got the Amazon slushie -- one of"Mr. Z Tea's favorite". It looks very questionable (yellow slushie, brown dots, and a green something on top), but it's actually very delicious! I don't remember the exact fruits in there, but the overall taste was passionfruit-ish. It also had shredded boba mixed in there -- highly recommend it!! 

I would definitely come back to venture out and try something new!

We ordered the watermelon green tea and mixed fruit tea. I really enjoyed the watermelon one but not so much the fruit one. They used fresh watermelon to blend it with green tea which made the drink really tasty and refreshing. The mixed fruit tea tasted weird because I think they put too many flavors in one cup or something. Service is a bit slow compared to a regular boba store so be prepared to wait for your drink. I will defintely come back but I'll probably avoid the mixed fruit tea.

I've got to admit that I am a boba enthusiast LOL. I found out that there was another boba place in town, and I was like cool, I've got to try it when I'm in the area! When I went inside Mr. Z's, the interior was so cute! I really like themed places because it gives these places personality so the zebra theme was definitely A1. 

Since this place seemed to have a ton of pictures of their slushes and drinks with blended boba, I decided to try their amazon drink, which had blended boba. I have never had a drink with blended boba before, so I was like might as well try it! It was an interesting experience because instead of chewing on regular balls of boba, I was chewing on little pieces of boba throughout the drink. The drink itself was a little too sweet for my taste, so I might ask for a sweetness adjustment the next time I visit.

The tea wasn't exactly bad but it wasn't exactly good but it wasn't okay either. I went in the afternoon but it still took thirty minutes for me to get my order of just two drinks. There were barely any customers so what's the hold up? Not only that but they only had one worker like really?? The jasmine milk tea tasted like sugar and water, that's probably why it was watery, and the boba was hard. Would give this one star but I gave an extra star for that poor single worker who was trying his best but not succeeding. Would not come again. There's a lot of better tea place in that area that is worth my time and money and this place is definitely not one of them.
We got the range butterfly & orange green tea absolutely delicious.... we need something refreshing after this

This place just recently opened and I stopped by to check it out. Seemed like they're still in the process of finishing the interior, so the space isn't complete yet. I ordered a Royal Milk Tea, and my friends ordered a Mr. Z Boba Milk Tea with boba and a Pudding Milk Tea. I really liked the Royal Milk Tea, wasn't too sweet and the tea flavor definitely dominates. My friend really liked the Pudding Milk Tea as well, a definitely go-to order for him. However, the Mr. Z Boba Milk Tea was, apparently, nothing out of the ordinary in terms of a signature milk tea. I like that they provide a stamp card, and the service wasn't too bad. Will definitely come back to try out more drinks, and to check out the finished space.

I am a boba fanatic. When I hear about a new boba place in town, I HAVE to try it out and Mr. Z just recently opened so I had to give them a visit. It's located inside the Cathay Plaza at Chinatown which surprised me because that plaza has been pretty dead for years already. When I entered, there was not a single customer inside and the workers seemed very bored, no energy. The place is simple and clean. There's only a small bar area with chairs on the left side to sit and other than that, there's no tables when there's a lot of empty spaces which isn't an ideal place to really hangout at. Their only trashcan is this large Sesame Street trashcan where you need to lift the lid in order to dispose your trash which I wouldn't want to touch. I do really like the huge zebra mural on the wall though. 

Upon ordering, the workers seem like this is either their first job or they had no training at all. They didn't really have knowledge of the drinks or know how to use the register. I came here two times to give a second try and they always needed someone else to help them out. I understand this is a new business but the communication is pretty awkward. 

I wasn't sure what to try so I decided to order something I don't normally get. I got their Red Bean Slushie with Boba since it was a Mr. Z favorite. I was the only customer there and it took way longer than needed to make my drink. However, I did fall in love with this drink! It wasn't too sweet or too bland. They put real red beans on top and the drink is just savory. The boba can be improved as its more toward the mushy side than the chewy, firm that I prefer. I also like how their Amazon Slushie has blended boba which is a great option for those who can't stand the chewing/full texture of boba. The second time I came here, my coworkers ordered the Mr. Z Boba Milk Tea which taste like any other milk teas but also a watered down version. 

They offer a stamp card and are currently offering BOGO 50%.

I think I'll come back when I crave for the Red Bean Slushie because it is really good. Not sure if I want to try other drinks though.

I saw this place driving by . The sign caught my eye from spring mountain and I'm glad we decided to try it ! They have small boba which I like better . Their boba is soft and chewy not hard like a few places I've been. The drinks were amazingly delicious and not overly sweet w syrup.. Again, like many other places . They also have really pretty and tasteful slushy concoctions . This is my new favorite boba spot. The only thing is they don't have tables. They only have high top w bar stools which doesn't matter much to me since I always take boba to go anyways .

Very authentic Taiwanese tea shop! I had a oolong milk tea half sugar with pudding, best I have had in Vegas! Decoration is cute and unique, love the overall branding. I do think it's kind of pricy though, $10+ for two drinks. I'll still come back for sure though!
Here green tea is really good. I tries almost kind of green tea from this shop and all of them is really good!

I came here to give this place a try, hence being brand new around my area. Well I was a little disappointed with the taste of my milk tea. It was Very bland, and no taste at all to it. I ordered the Green Milk tea, and all I taste was water and milk. I mean they just open not too long ago but maybe I was expecting a "bang"out of my drink. Sadly I was just left with the drink still being half full. The boba pearl texture was a little mushy. 

Just not my place for a cup of tea I guess, but customer service was very helpful and greetful. This place is for other people but not for me.

It's the best tea here. I like orange green tea so much!
???????????????
Ordered the Orange green tea with aloe soo refreshing soo Good so worth the drive for this
This is the best brewed tea place I've tried so far in Vegas! Their decorations of the shop is cute too. A very modern place to go and hang out with friends!

Small, but nice boba place--they did a good job getting the sweetness level to not-so-sweet (25%) on my taro tea. The place is, as I said at the outset, small--not very many seats, and I saw no outlets, so I don't think it's a place to hang out or study. But the beverages are good.
First time here. Very much enjoyed their watermelon green tea. So refreshing and hydrating

I'm obsessed with Mr. Z's ocean iced coffee. It has such a pretty presentation with the coffee, milk, and ocean flavoring, then when you stir it around, it blends together perfectly. The flavor is great too. Not to mention you can put your extra textures, like mini boba, regular boba, or jellies. If you're in Chinatown, I'd say screw starbucks and come here. Plus you get a stamp card for regulars. Also, can we just appreciate their cute decor? Love this place!

The store is so cute!!!!!!! Love this place at first sight~ of coz their drinks r very delicious!!!!! Especially the seasonal fresh fruit smoothie!!!! Must try~  ! A frd too k me there when I visit Vegas~ at first I thought what's so good abt this place ..we have so many different style boba tea place in LA ... yet , fall in love w this place when I first walk in to it... from the decorations u can totally feel the passionate that all the employees hav with this place~ every employees r very polite and nice, of coz they still need more trainings (the place still new) ~ love love this place and their drinks..wish they can open one in LA .... ! This place is a must try !!! If u r craving for boba tea while you r in Vegas~ trust me ..u won't retreat it just like me!!!!

First time visiting Mr Z, omg what a great decision it was, i have officially found the go-to tea shop in Las Vegas!!!  I have always been a huge boba tea fan, but was never able to find somewhere thats on par with what we have in Los Angeles.  Good thing it has changed now that i found Mr Z!!!

I ordered the orange green tea and it is made with 100% real orange juice!!  Freshly squeezed in front of me after the order was placed!!  It is that fresh!!  Definitely one of the best orange green tea i have had!!  On the same level as tea bar orange green tea in SoCal if not even better!!

My wife got the red bean milk tea and she loved it as well!!  The store is super clean, the staff was extremely nice and friendly!  5 stars quality drink and 5 star service!!

Lastly, the restroom is the cleanest i have ever seen in a restaurant, tea shop type of place!!  Unreal!!  I can tell the owner pays attention to every details of the business!!

Highly recommended!!  Will definitely return the next time i am in

I've been here multiple times now and I think it's time for a review! :) Gotta say I was Skeptical about this place in the beginning because of where it was located but you shouldn't judge a place by its cover. When I came inside I just fell in love with the decoration! It's Zebra themed which I think is cool. 

On to the drinks. I recommend trying the Oolong tea with boba. One of my all time favorites. They also offer stamp cards so I also recommend taking advantage of that. Every time I visit here it's so chill, makes me want to come back.

Dropped by Mr Z yesterday yesterday after a hot long day of driving with my friend. She suggested we go here because the drinks looked super refreshing and they really were!

Came into shop and were quickly greeted, staff was pretty cool he explained a little bit of the menu for us. I went for the yogurt butterly pea, and she went for the other butterfly drink, the containers they came in were suuuuuper cute! The drink was so cute also, it came with chia seeds and dear god were they refreshing. Yogurt a bit tart for my taste but nonetheless so so good!

The store decore was on point. LOVE the zebra theme, the zebra floaty, the brick wall, the fluffy cotton clouds. They also have stamp cards c:
Pricey but the boba and drink isnt bad.  Nice place with half zebras everywhere.
Great drink and add-on choices, friendly staff, and pretty quick service.  You can ask your server for suggestions, and they are pretty helpful. The only negative I would say is limited seating.
Don't order drinks with delivery service, unless you want half drinks gone and spilled out everywhere in the plastics bags
